intro: Mascagnia prunifolia, commonly known as the red mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its stems are woody and often branched, with a reddish hue. Mascagnia prunifolia is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
